title: Pre-Service Foreign Language Teachers’ Continuous Professional Development (CPD) Program via 3D Virtual Environment-Based Collaborative Learning: Enhancing Social Interaction and Educational Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Core competencies for foreign language teachers, experience with digital tools, and foundational understanding of social interaction and multicultural education
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning in 3D virtual environments using smartphones, emphasizing social learning contexts to promote global citizenship education and intercultural understanding. The program aims to drive institutional changes in educational settings and expand civic engagement.

learning_goals: Preservice foreign language teachers enhance their ability to design and implement collaborative tasks using the Jigsaw instructional method in a 3D virtual environment, while exploring social interaction strategies in multicultural educational settings.

Learners develop three types of instructional materials (quizzes, video lectures, worksheets) through real-time (video conferencing tools) and asynchronous (email/collaboration platforms) interactions with workplace peers. They incorporate at least three out of five peer feedbacks into the final materials, strengthening intercultural communication and collaboration skills.

Participants establish Continuing Professional Development (CPD) strategies applicable to real-world educational contexts based on collaborative learning experiences in virtual environments, and explore community-linked educational innovation plans.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
